Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Erase \E*rase"\ ([-e]*r[=a]s"), v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Erased} ([-e]*r[=a]st"); p. pr. & vb. n.. {Erasing}.] [L. erasus, p. p. of eradere to erase; e out + radere to scrape, scratch, shave. See {Rase}.] 1. To rub or scrape out, as letters or characters written, engraved, or painted; to efface; to expunge; to cross out; as, to erase a word or a name. [1913 Webster]
2. Fig.: To obliterate; to expunge; to blot out; -- used of ideas in the mind or memory. --Burke. [1913 Webster]

erase v 1: remove from memory or existence; "The Turks erased the Armenians in 1915" [syn: {wipe out}] 2: remove by or as if by rubbing or erasing; "Please erase the formula on the blackboard--it is wrong!" [syn: {rub out}, {score out}, {efface}, {wipe off}] 3: wipe out magnetically recorded information [syn: {delete}] [ant: {record}]
